title: Niagara
description:
The Office travels to Niagara Falls to celebrate Jim and Pam's wedding under strict orders not to mention Pam's pregnancy. Michael, Dwight, and Andy all want to hook up with guests at the wedding and Michael and Dwight meet twins.
Pam is forced to deal with an embarrassing injury for Andy the night before her wedding, while Kevin deals with the loss of his dress shoes on the morning of the ceremony.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry. You guys have probably noticed my stomach's a little more sensitive lately. So, if you wouldn't mind wearing a little less perfume... and if your lunch is especially pungent, maybe have it in the break room?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We would really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam is constantly throwing up because of the pregnancy. If she eats something the fetus doesn't like she is screwed. It's amazing. A three ounce fetus is calling the shots. It's so bad ass.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis, if you could switch to a different soap, just for a month or two? Yours is kind of perfumy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Now this is getting ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, gee, I'm sorry. I guess I missed the meeting where we all all voted for you to get pregnant. No! I reserve the right to peel my hard-boiled eggs at my desk.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: All morning I look forward to my afternoon cigars and I'm not stopping for anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think I'm asking for too much. I guess it's just the end of courtesy in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Dwight peels a hard-boiled egg at his desk, sniffs it and takes a bite; Pam stares at him, picks up her trash can and pukes into it] Watching people get sick always makes me sick. And... frankly so does talking about it. So... wow...  [Andy, Phyllis, Meredith, Erin, Oscar and Angela all proceed to throw up in various places while Creed looks on eating a bowl of noodles; Dwight stares shocked; Pam wipes her mouth with a satisfied look]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing next to a car decorated for leaving a wedding] What do you think? I spent all morning on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is really special.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but aren't you supposed to do that to our... no. It's great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's just a really important day for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, congrats.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin Scranton will be closed today and Friday for a company wedding in Niagara Falls. So, please leave a message and we'll get back to you as soon as possible. Have a great day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Believe it or not, Kevin, fire crackers are in the don't column.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So... you're going to provide them, then?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. This is a fire cracker free wedding.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What the hell?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. You've got to be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. All of these things are important to remember but the most important thing is no one say anything about my pregnancy at the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely. 'Cause not everyone knows and some people may be offended.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Decent people everywhere will get offended.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, we're thinking of my grandmother who we haven't told and is very old-fashioned.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, you're lucky you have a grandmother. Some of us have to be our own grandmothers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, Angela, you don't have to come to the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really, Pam...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes she does. Yes she does. We're all gonna go and we're gonna have a good time. [hugs Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ow! He pinched me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Next time we're all in this room Jim and I will be married.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We'll see.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good-bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See you later. [others say good-bye]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And, hey, don't embarrass me when we go to Niagara.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What happens in Niagara, stays in Niagara. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't. Don't. Don't. You stole my joke. Don't steal my joke.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No... I didn't steal your joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. I said that yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you can say that about anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What happens in accounting, stays in accounting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. No. Please, please. Dwight, that's my joke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's easy. That's what I'm saying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is what I'm talking about. When we leave here and go up to Niagara Falls we are representing Dunder Mifflin, everyone. This is a very important wedding for the branch. The most important wedding until I get married. So, I want you all on your best behavior or so help me, God. So... I will see you up there in Viagra Falls!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam and Jim's wedding will be the single best pick up destination in the history of the universe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I stole the guest list from Jim's desk and I search engined every female on both sides of the family.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For instance, Pam's cousin, Jocelyn Webster.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's... a name.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two years ago she was selling a mountain bike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Well, tell me about Jocelyn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well... she was really into mountain biking but not so much lately.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She had a couple hundred dollars to spend, I mean, if she was able to sell her bike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is that all you have on her?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, if this is in fact her because it is a very common name.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: People don't think of me as one of the sharper dressers in the office... but I'm going ot turn that around at this wedding. I thought, how could I take it to the next level? The hair. [Angela beeps her car horn.] It's the hair- [beeps again.] Ok. Ok. I'm going. [long beep] God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in Andy's car, Andy driving] Hey, do one of you guys want to sit up front with me so I have someone to talk to?  It's like a five hour drive-ish, you know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is so much cooler. We feel like wer're in a limo and you're our driver.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm. Erin?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh no. That wouldn't be fair to leave Kelly alone in back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not only is Erin really sweet and cute... she smell's like my mom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in car] Hey, my aunt told me something neat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She said everything with the wedding goes by so fast we should try to take mental pictures of the high points.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, wow. That's cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [aims imaginary camera at Pam] Click. Oh, you blinked. Damn it. Now that's in my brain forever.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Lousy Picture.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We should have hired a professional to take our mental pictures.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in car, Michael driving] Oh! God! Wow! Oh. I was asleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? No way!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those glasses are super dark.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. We need some tunes, I think.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? I made you a cd...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You did?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was nice of you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is to play when you bring a woman back to your hotel room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, very thoughtful. A little mix to set the mood. Delightful. Pop that in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're gonna like this. [Dwight's voice on the cd] "Hello. This is Dwight Schrute. If you are listening to this you are a lucky woman Michael has seduced. Ah to be in your shoes. 'What's next?', you're probably wondering. Don't be scared of you're night in heaven-" [Michael turns off cd]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you serious? You want me to play that for a woman coming to my room?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. It's practical.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. That's not how it works.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Niagara Falls used to be, like, a spiritual experience for people. They stayed in tents and it blew their minds. It's really kitchy now, which is a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Halpert...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And Beesly. Tonight we're in two seperate rooms and tomorrow night is the honeymoon suite.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. We're pretty excited, too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can we take a look at the suite now?

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Somebody just checked in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh... is there another wedding at the hotel this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Oh, no. Just an individual. That man over there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. I got the room the night before you guys. I'll break in the bed. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm gonna need the name and cell phone number of the housekeeper responsible for changing the sheets, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. Reservation for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: One moment while I check.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The proximity to the falls makes everything smell like a basement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: I'm sorry, sir, but I'm not seeing you in here. When did you make your reservation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't have a reservation but I want a room in the Halpert-Beesly block of rooms.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Oh, ok. Unfortunately, sir, the block only applies to the rate. I'm afraid we're all sold out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute. I have a reservation. Confirmation number: Romeo. Tango. G7745.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Yes. Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I had spoken to Teresa about a room with two safes?

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Sure. No problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Front Desk Clerk
quotes.text: Here's your key, Mr. Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Dwight, Dwight. I need to stay in your room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No way. What if I meet someone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm staying in your-  Come on, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would do the same for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You would?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes... just go-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait a second. Oh. No, no, no. This must be some kind of mistake. This reservation seems to be under an M. Scott. This must be yours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no. Now that I don't have a room, can I stay with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um... no. And you know what? I would say yes but you can't. And I'll tell you why.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If I have a woman up there and things are getting amorous, she's going to get turned off if she looks in he bathroom and sees you brushing your teeth with butter and clay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. Ok. A-ha-ha! [rips reservation out of Michael's hand] That was a test. You have failed. For this is my room. You would not share with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't have a room?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No you do not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. 'Oooh. You must pass the dungeon wisdom test.'

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It worked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jerk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When Mary was denied a room at the inn... Jesus was born. When Michael was denied a room at the inn, we don't know what happens because that story hasn't been told yet.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Stanley? Can I stay in your room tonight?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Are you crazy? I brought Cynthia with me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not in the same bed. In the other bed.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I got one queen size bed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You... are... kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: A queen size bed is five feet wide. I am not five feet wide, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not a physics major, Stanley. I'm just saying be careful. Hey, guys. Hey. Could I stay in your room tonight?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. Gross.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Blow my brains out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's rude.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, I have one extra twin bed, if you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are going to be slepping by yourself for the rest of your life, so you just get used to it.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Halpert
quotes.text: So, which one is Pam's grandma?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Mema? She's the one in the teal suit. She's the only 80 year old with no smile wrinkles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dad, remember, no mention of the baby, right?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Halpert
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. She's very conservative. So, mum's the word.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mom, Dad. This is Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Halpert
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How ya doin'?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Halpert
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Halpert
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who's doing a toast? I would like to go third. Sort of bat clean up and-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, I thought we discussed that we would rather you not speak, like, at all. Because it's just going to be blood relatives, I think.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking quietly, trying not to move his lips]That is seriously going to impeed my ability to hook up with your female relatives.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pretty sure everyone heard that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Didn't move my lips.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Mema.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: I wasn't sure about your branch of the family. After I heard about your parent's divorce. But you and Jim are just perfect. God bless you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Thank you... but nobody's perfect.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: Well... I wouldn't care to live if I thought that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mr. Beesly. How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Beesly
quotes.text: I'd like you to meet Christy Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Is this, uh, is this your niece?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Beesly
quotes.text: [laughs] No no. She's my girlfriend. Hey? Can you make room at the head table?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: From quarter three to quarter four up 17 percent, while his sales down two percent. It's all in the report.

quotes.speaker: Little Girl
quotes.text: Why would they make the bad man a boss if you're so much smarter?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excellent question. Because while I was busy trying to improve the company and make it a success, Jim... the bad man was busy kissing the boss man's butt.

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: Ewwww!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right. It is ew. It is very ew.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar, Kevin, this is my sister, Penny. She's also my maid of honor.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pleased to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: I'm sorry, it's Kevin. I thought it was Gil?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She thought I was your boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You thought I was dating this? What the hell is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar, it was an honest mistake.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Him? Him?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oscar, I would be proud to date you.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm not gay. I'm Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: Nice to meet you, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You owe me and apology.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you seeing anyone right now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She has a boyfriend. He's out of town.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to a girl sitting next to him] I was the youngest VP in the company history.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: More recently, he worked in a bowling alley. Tell her one of your funny bowling alley stories.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um... also-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How did Meredith get put at the young people's table?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She probably switched cards with someone. Like I did with Erin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? You're kid- That's- You're-

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Jim and Pam, I can't tell you how happy I am to be here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Head table, where I belong.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just for family.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, who's that one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Isabel Poreba. Oh, I've got stuff on her. [laughs] In 1996 her tenth grade volleyball team went 10-2.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What am I supposed to do with that, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's a very good record.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Alright, so I'll be like, 'You're so sweet guys and so kind'.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: That's when I'll do the face, like-

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Like, 'What? What?'. And then we'll just give him a little punch in the back and-

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: A noogie?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: You know what? Never too married for a noogie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They have hilarious material and they are going to totally deliver it wrong. I would kill with the brother stuff. It should be me... up there. It should be me and Pete, not Pete and Tom.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Pam, you've got the greatest smile and you're body is really fine.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Smoking.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Hoping it'll make our wives take it up a notch.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: A little mo' cardio.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not appropriate. Hello. Hi, everybody. I promised I wasn't gonna make a toast and I'm not going to. Just going to do a little free standing comedy and if at the end everybody wants to raise their glasses to Pam and Jim, then so be it. Hey, what is the deal with the Smart Car? How smart is that? Those things are tiny. Can you even drive them in traffic? 'I'm so smart. E=mc... squared. I drive a Smart Car.' That's not smart in my book. The real smart car is Kitt from Knight Rider.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Knight Rider.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a car that can talk. Can Smart Car talk? Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not smart. And also, Chitty Chitty Bang Bang. [no one is laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very smart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And... you... everybody can laugh. It doesn't have to just be the idiots. Everybody can laugh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Hey, everyone. Thanks for coming.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Douche.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, thanks, Pete. That was really nice. I just want to say how happy we are that all of you are here tonight. And I want to especially thank those of you who traveled from far away to be here with us tonight... especially the Flordia cousins who, obviously, can't take a hint. [laughter] Four years ago, I was just a guy who had a crush on a girl who had a boyfriend. And I had to do the hardest thing that I've ever had to do... which was just to wait. Uh, don't get me wrong. I flirted with her. Pam, I can now admit in front of my friends and family that I do know how to make a photo copy. Didn't need your help that many times. And do you remember how long it took you to teach me how to drive a stick?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like... a year.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've been driving stick since high school. So... yes. For a really long time that's all I had. I just had little moments with a girl who saw me as friend. And a lot of people told me I was crazy to wait this long for a date with a girl who I worked with, but I think even then I knew that... I was waiting for my wife. So...  I would like to propose a toast. So if you'd all raise your glasses. Not Pam, for obvious reasons, but everyone else. If you would raise your glasses-

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: What's obvious? Why can't Pam drink?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam can't drink? I didn't- I shouldn't have said that. I don't know why I did. She can do whatever she wants, though she shouldn't. She shouldn't because she's an alcoholic. Pam is an alcoholic. That's not true. I- no. What we want- the real reason is that, that Pam's pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Ok. Ok. Hey. What I think Jim is trying to say is that... they had an accident and you know what? These two people, they're living together, they're having lots of consentual sex-

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: They were living together?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Yes they were living together. Yes and you know what? You can't expect them to be careful every time. Because, frankly, it's just a different sensation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When you c- well? Am I wrong? They say it's not different, but it's a different sensation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When you use something to block- I think everybody knows what I am talking about. It's not necessarily different for the woman-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...but it's different for the- ok. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael. Stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. My point is I said what I wanted to say and Mema, I hope you heard every word.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: To waiting.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: [quiet and scattered] To waiting.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: I should have known. The hotels television set had a movie on called "Bruno" last night. The remote control had so darn many buttons on it, I couldn't turn it off. So I had to just sit there while it happened to me. I wondered, 'How could they pick such a hotel?' Hmmm. Now I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mema.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a little touch and go at first but I think we saved it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't believe it was me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. I can't believe it was you, either. I actually think it takes a lot of pressure off of me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is there something about being a manager that makes you say stupid things?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have not found that to be the case.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, smooth guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you believe it? He screwed up, not me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mema's not coming to the wedding. She's leaving tomorrow morning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's gonna be a free room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi, Mema. It's Michael.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: Oh. You're that foul guy that kept talking about intercourse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Yep. One in the same. May I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am actually great with old women. In fact, for the longest time, my best friend was my grandma... and then she met Harriet and now she thinks she's better than everybody.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: I want to go to bed but I can't. I can't turn that television off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Ok. Well... hook you up, there. [turns off tv]

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: Oh. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: It was that horrible Charlie Rose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Isn't he terrible? May I? Here's the thing. Umm... Mema, I think you just need to chill out about this whole Pam getting pregnant thing. It's not 1890 anymore. It's modern day. And women have sex before marriage and I think we need to celebrate that. And I know in your day she would be considered a whore but, now, women go out and they have sex and they get wild and they take their tops off and they have pictures taken of them and we need to encouage them. That's part of life.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: People are like cats and dogs these days.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: This used to be such a great country.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: I don't know what happened to it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're gonna name the baby after you, you know. They're gonna call it Mema.

quotes.speaker: Sylvia
quotes.text: You mean, Sylvia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, and if it's a boy they will call it Sylvio.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Partay. Room 639.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Chicks are gonna be off the hook. Guys, too, Oscar. Like Calvin Klein models.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That sounds epic. Can we bring anything?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nothing. Except $40 for beer and any hot chicks you know. 'Cause that would help me deliver on some promises I made. Woo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No one from the office has been to a real Bernard throw down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I was girl, I would seriously reconsdier coming to this party. But don't tell anyone that I said that, 'cause I want them to come.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And where do you think you're going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was just going to go down to the hotel bar for a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, why don't I just save you some time and kick you in the stomach instead?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just wanted to get out of my room for a little while.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm. Ok. I'll go with you. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Nevermind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It'll be fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you wearing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? It's a casual, social outfit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Looks like you're going to a fish fry, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. They're howling at the moon. It's suggestive to women because of the howling during sex.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. [Dwight howls] That's not appropriate. [Dwight continues howling] Uncool. Uncool, Dwight. [they both howl] Ok. Ok. Come on. Let's go. [both howl as they exit]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not a good idea. There's no such thing as a good hairpiece.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. But that's easy enough for you to say, Oscar. You have that thick, beautiful, Chicano hair. So nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just worried about the farm, ya know? Mose hates to geld the horses by himself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, Dwight. Shut up about the farm. It's not relatable. Nobody owns a farm.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Wait. You're worried about your horses? That's cool. How many horses do you have?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nine and three-quarters.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I invented a device called 'Burger on the Go'. It allows you to obtain 6 regular size hamburgers, or 12 sliders, from a horse without killing the animal. George Foreman is still considering it. Sharper Image is still considering it. Sky Mall's considering it. Hammacher Schlemer is still considering it. Sears said, 'No'.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking to an attractive woman] Toy Story, Finding Nemo, Up. I ball the entire time. I can not watch Pixar.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Drop this one. Abort.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I found twins.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God. Twins. I'm sorry. You understand. Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aren't they magnificent?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're men, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I love finding a good set of twins.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Something is wrong with you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [everyone is dancing] Go Meredith. Nice moves.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You call that a robot? Try being more robotic, ok? Like this.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Lame! What else you got, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How about a little bit of this.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh yeah. What else you got?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What else you got?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did someone change my name to Baskin Robbin? Because I feel like a banana split. Woo! [Andy does a split and screams out in pain]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What else you got?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's gonna be fine. It's gonna be fine. Pam's here. [knocks on Pam's door] Pam? [knocks again]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was dancing and I did a split and I landed on my car keys in my pocket.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I tore my scrotum. I need you to take me to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy, I am getting married in 8 hours.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everyone else is too drunk.  Just don't let me die here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey, hey! Where are you?  Can you take Andy to the hospital?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [over phone] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He tore his scrotum dancing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [over phone] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He is in my room icing his balls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [over phone] What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please stop saying what.  Can you take him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, I would so take him in any other circumstance, but I'm pretty certain I'm completely wasted.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your brothers took you out drinking?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [over phone]  Is that Pam?  Hey, have her come out!  Have her come out!  It would be like Coyote Ugly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's Michael.  You're out with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [over phone] And Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [over phone] Hey-O!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, it just happened.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, fine.  I'll take him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I love you.  Okay, I gotta-I gotta go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [over phone] I love you! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you pushing me off the phone?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Let's talk for a long time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Goodbye. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm!  It's after midnight. [points at Jim]

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {dwight}
quotes.text: You're married. [hugs Jim] He's married!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not how that works.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.  You're not going to be able to talk back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You'll have Pam to answer to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She'll be sitting home saying, "Jim... take the baby to the zoo cause I want to sit at home and eat bon-bons."  [Dwight laughs] "And... and clip my toenails."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Jim... hey why don't you braid my hair.  I want to watch TV."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now you sound like Kermit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you sure this is the right way?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope.  I, like you, have never been here before.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, at least slow down a little bit because every little bump in the road is major pain on... my scrotum.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Look, I'm not the one who asked you to do a split when you've never done one before.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was trying to liven things up a little bit.  I was kinda doing your job so-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My job?  My job is to get married in the morning.  That's my job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well it's also to make sure that we have a great time at your stupid wedding, so-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Pam swerves the car back and forth] Ow, ow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [snickers] I spent the night with the bride the night before the wedding.  Ah yeah.  She stepped on my hand on her way to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy, did I dream that you were crying through the night?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.  No that was real.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [folding his pants on top of the ice machine, man walks in with ice bucket] Why don't you take a picture.  It'll last longer.  God.  Can't I get a little privacy?

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: [Kevin rings bell at the front desk] Good morning.  How can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I left a pair of dress shoes in a bag outside my door last night to be cleaned at polished, but they haven't been returned yet.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: You  must be Mr. Malone.  One moment please.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: [whispers to manager] Sir.  It's the man with the shoes.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Manager
quotes.text: Mr. Malone.  Your shoes are gone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They were stolen?

quotes.speaker: Hotel Manager
quotes.text: No. Destroyed.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Hotel Manager
quotes.text: The bag was opened by our shoe shine and the smell overcame him.  I too smelled them and made the choice that they must be thrown away.  Incinerated actually.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But that was my only pair of shoes.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Manager
quotes.text: It became a safety issue, sir.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well... well damn-it.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: I can offer you a complimentary breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walking out of hotel room with a woman] You have everything?

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Hmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cell phone?  Charger?

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Yeah.  So you sure you don't want breakfast?  It's the most important meal of the day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It really is.  I'm not hungry.  I ate a whole bunch of sunflower seeds after you went to sleep.  And besides, I wouldn't want to take you away from Pam on the morning of her wedding.  She needs you Isabel.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: That's really sweet, Dwight.  So I'll see you at the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know it.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: K.  [they kiss]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [passes Isabel] Hey, good morning.  [to Dwight] It's about damn time.  I haven't gone to the bathroom in a day and a half.  [walks into hotel room]  Oh my God, Dwight.  This room is a pit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [lays on bed] Really?  I hadn't noticed.  Too busy knocking boots.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [watching Dwight eat breakfast] How can you eat like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm ravenous after a night of love making.  You?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm hungry, but I'm not going to make a pig out of myself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, what was she like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She was cute.  You know?  She was hot.  She was very hot.  She made love like a tiger.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Brides side or grooms side?  Or townie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She was from Europe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I bet she had hairy armpits.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Isabel was nice, but I hope she doesn't think this is going anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second.  You're not into her?  Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's Pam's best friend.  You guys could double date.  Swap maybe?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh please.  Put a gun in my mouth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... you're crazy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look.  She's a dental hygienist from Carbondale and she makes love like one.  She's a bumpkin.  Pass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She's- okay.  Do you know how hard it is to be a hygienist?  You have to take x-rays.  You have to scrape the plaque off of people's teeth.  You have to tell kids when to spit and make sure they're not scared when the dentist comes in.  It- it-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You should ask her out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [stands up and walks away]  I already have my European girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If your hat hits me in the face one more time-

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's funny.  Your wife loved this hat the last time she saw it. [glares at Stanley's date]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sees Kevin's toupee] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oscar.  Angela.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Are you in a lot of pain?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh cause of last night?  No way.  Reports have been exaggerated.  Weddings make me very emotional.  I um-I just have that side to me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: People say you cry all the time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well that's not-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Crotch injuries are the worst.  You don't need to tell me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I wasn't telling you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Is there still something there?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: It didn't get torn off?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, it didn't-nothing got torn off.  Who told you that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I may have told some people that.  I'm nervous.  I'm about to get married.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: If you want to sit on this- [hands Andy her wrap] I was thinking the wood might be too hard on your damaged penis.  Make it softer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It was my scrotum.  Um, and it was.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, here we go.  They asked for cash, but you know... I give them cash every week, so- how much cash does a person need?  I have taken it upon myself to do something a little more special.  I have painted a portrait of the two of them from memory.  [holds up painting]  And I have another one of them in the nude.  But that one is for me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got them a set of turtle boiling pots, a shell hammer and bibs.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: Is it zipping over your belly? Don't squish the baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you weirdo.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: everybody see Kristie's stupid blonde extensions?  It's like they were made from a plastic broom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, here I come. [walks out in her wedding dress]

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh darling!  You look beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks mom.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, I hope he deserves you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He does.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Are you sure?  Remember you don't have to do this.  You don't.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: Mom, you're totally projecting.  You're being a drag.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you, mom.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Hey, I'm going to go outside and talk to Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay great.  [Isabel kisses her cheek] Yeah, I'll see you in a second.  [pauses] Wait, what? [tries to follow, but veil gets caught on wall and tears] Oh! Oh no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [answers cell phone] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you come here please?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is this allowed?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  No, but I'm allowing it.  Just come here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking to a woman] That was an intelligent comment.

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Hello stranger.  How do I look?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.  Fine.  Isabel, [holds out hand] nice to see you.  What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: Um... [shakes head] nothing.  Anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [turns back to other woman] So, uh tell me again the difference between Filene's and Filene's basement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Isabel] Hey, hey... He's not sitting with me either.  Where are you sitting?  You need a seat buddy?

quotes.speaker: Isabel
quotes.text: I'm standing.  I'm a bridesmaid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I wish I was a bridesmaid.  Where am I gonna go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.  You look-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So beautiful. [Pam's starts to cry.  Jim pulls up chair to sit next to her] Hey-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My veil tore.  I knew when we were getting married and I'm five months pregnant that I'm not going to be able to wear the dress that I always wanted or high heels-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [takes her hand] Hey.  You look just as I imagined you would.  Pam, you're so pretty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And who cares?  It's a stupid veil, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, this was the one thing I was supposed to be able to control, was this veil and- [Jim cuts off half his tie]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There.  Now we're even.  [Pam laughs and mimes taking a picture, they kiss]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Everyone's driving me crazy.  I know way too much about Andy's scrotum.  [Jim chuckles] And my mom won't stop freaking out about my dad's new girlfriend.  [sighs] This is supposed to be our wedding day.  Why did we invite all these people?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think Pam ran away because she knew deep down  she wouldn't be a good wife.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to Kevin who is bouncing up and down]  What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm trying to decide if I have time to pee.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How long do you take to pee?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The peeing is fast, Oscar.  It's getting my tie back on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Pam's mom] Hey.  Hi.  Do you-would you have a snack in your purse?  You're a mom.  I just figured you might have-

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, yeah-[hands Michael a snack]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!  Eww... apricot.  Do you have any of the Very Berry or Ocean Splash or-

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... okay.  Were you saving it?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no.  That's okay.  I was just-I've had a very rough weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry. [puts food in his mouth] Ugh.  Apricot.  Made of real apes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you think they canceled the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Relax.  You'll get your shot at Jim.  Those two treat the whole office like a 1970's key party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: my weekend was bad so far.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I came here hoping to meet somebody.  You know, as you do at weddings.  End up going to sleep by the vending machine.  It was loud, but it was warm.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh that sounds awful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And... and the love of my life is dating somebody else.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Oh-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is a terrible year for love.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Yeah.  Guess it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm thinking about having my sperm frozen.

quotes.speaker: Tom Halpert
quotes.text: Excuse me, are you Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Heard you might have a whoopee cushion on you.

quotes.speaker: Pete Halpert
quotes.text: Sisters in the can and we totally want to get her when she comes back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow.  That sounds hilarious.  I do actually. [pulls whoopee cushion out of pocket and hands it to them]  There you go.  Use it in good health.

quotes.speaker: {tom-halpert} and {pete-halpert}
quotes.text: [laughing] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa.  Wait a minute.  What is the etiquette on taking the gifts?  Can you only take your own back or is it a whatever you can carry type of thing?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Anyone have anything they want to trade for a toaster?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, oh, does it have slots for hot dogs?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Who would want it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guys, maybe we should wait a little more time before we start grabbing boxes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd like to lodge a formal complaint against Jim for making us wait for over an hour.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looks over and sees hole in his present]  Crap.  [sees turtle on the ground, goes over and picks it up]  Come here you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well I guess this weddings not going to happen.  I wonder if this is it for them.  [Jim and Pam walk in laughing]

quotes.speaker: Pam's Dad
quotes.text: Hey.  What happened?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Where were you guys?  Do you know how long I've been waiting here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well we are here now, so let's just-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks up] Yes! Yes!  I have so much joy...  in my heart... right now.  How do I look?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You look great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You look great.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: [looks at Jim's cut tie] Wear a tie much?

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: [music starts playing and people start dancing down the isle] I begged them not to.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: I know you specifically put this song on your Do Not Play list.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes I did.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiles] Go ahead.  I think it's your turn.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: Wait, what happened?  You're okay with this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm okay.

quotes.speaker: Penny
quotes.text: Okay then! [takes flower girl to dance down the isle]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam, did you see this? It was on You Tube.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Saw it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I bought those boat tickets the day I saw that You Tube video.  I knew we'd need a back-up plan.  The boat was actually Plan C.  The church was Plan B and Plan A was marrying her a long, long time ago.  Pretty much the day I met her.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What an awesome party.  The best wedding I've ever been too.  I got six numbers.  One more would have been a complete telephone number.  This was epic.  My Kleenex shoes were a huge conversation piece, but man my dogs are barking.  [sticks his feet into the hotel ice machine]  Whoo.  My feet were so sweaty I can't even feel the cold.  What a lovely hotel.
